title: Mobile Mini-Case Learning for Drug Therapy Interactions

context.prior_knowledge: Completion of advanced courses and extensive practical experience in specialized fields
context.additional_context: Interactive case-based learning program conducted in a smartphone-centric limited-technology environment.

learning_goals: Learners can explain treatment principles for major diseases (degenerative arthritis/gout) with 90% accuracy.
Through interactive mini-cases, learners consider patient-specific factors (age, medical history) in drug selection with over 80% accuracy.
Via project-based assessments, learners can propose strategies for managing drug interactions in real clinical scenarios.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
